title: Catalonia's heroic insurrectionists show us the real meaning of protest
text:
How unlike our pampered 'People's Vote' plodders they are

The first thing I did after sobering up on Victory Morning – June 24th 2016 – was book a trip to Barcelona; with the end of the EU yoke in sight, I was once more ready to revel in the glorious diversity of Europe – and because of another more partisan impulse. For we Brexiteers, Catalonia is a prime example of the impotence of strutting, bragging Brussels – all grandiose faux-national anthems, imaginary armies and delusions of adequacy – yet hopeless at protecting the civil rights of those within its clammy embrace.

In 2017, for a few blazing days after the regional president Carles Puigdemont won the succession referendum, my favourite...
description: How unlike our pampered 'People's Vote' plodders they are
